statement.p: I saw a job opening for a Graphic Designer that pays \displaystyle\${79},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{40} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{50} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 79,000 per year into dollars per hour.

If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${79000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?

myopenmath.solution:
B: 1 year/50 weeks
B: 1 week/40 hours
39.5
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 79000 dollars
1 year = 50 weeks
1 week = 40 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 79,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${79000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{50}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{40}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${79000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{50}\cdot{40}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\approx\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays dollars/hour.
